REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Notes¶

async src.repository.notes.create_note(body: NoteModel, user: User, db: Session) → Note¶

Creates a new note for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (NoteModel) – The data for the note to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created note.

Return type:

Note

async src.repository.notes.get_note(note_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Note¶

Retrieves a single note with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • note_id (int) – The ID of the note to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The note with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Note | None

async src.repository.notes.get_notes(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Note]¶

Retrieves a list of notes for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of notes to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of notes to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve notes for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of notes.

Return type:

List[Note]

async src.repository.notes.remove_note(note_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶

Removes a single note with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • note_id (int) – The ID of the note to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed note, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Note | None

async src.repository.notes.update_note(note_id: int, body: NoteUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶

Updates a single note with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • note_id (int) – The ID of the note to update.

  • body (NoteUpdate) – The updated data for the note.

  • user (User) – The user to update the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated note, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Note | None

async src.repository.notes.update_status_note(note_id: int, body: NoteStatusUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Note | None¶

Updates the status (i.e. “done” or “not done”) of a single note with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • note_id (int) – The ID of the note to update.

  • body (NoteStatusUpdate) – The updated status for the note.

  • user (User) – The user to update the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated note, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Note | None

REST API repository Tags¶

async src.repository.tags.create_tag(body: TagModel, user: User, db: Session) → Tag¶

Create a new tag for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (TagModel) – The attributes of the new tag.

  • user (User) – The user object that will own the new tag.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created Tag object.

Return type:

Tag

async src.repository.tags.get_tag(tag_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Tag¶

Retrieve a specific tag that belongs to a user.

Parameters:

  • tag_id (int) – The ID of the tag to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user object that owns the tag.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The Tag object with the specified ID.

Return type:

Tag

async src.repository.tags.get_tags(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Tag]¶

Retrieve all tags that belong to a specific user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of records to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of records to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user object that owns the tags.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of Tag objects.

Return type:

List[Tag]

async src.repository.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Tag | None¶

Remove a tag that belongs to a user.

Parameters:

  • tag_id (int) – The ID of the tag to remove.

  • user (User) – The user object that owns the tag.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The Tag object that was removed.

Return type:

Tag | None

async src.repository.tags.update_tag(tag_id: int, body: TagModel, user: User, db: Session) → Tag | None¶

Update an existing tag that belongs to a user.

Parameters:

  • tag_id (int) – The ID of the tag to update.

  • body (TagModel) – The new attributes of the tag.

  • user (User) – The user object that owns the tag.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated Tag object.

Return type:

Tag | None

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generates a JWT access token with a specified expiration time (in seconds).

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The duration (in seconds) for which the token is valid.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict) → str¶

Generates a JWT email verification token.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

Returns:

The encoded email verification token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generates a JWT refresh token with a specified expiration time (in seconds).

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The duration (in seconds) for which the token is valid.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Decodes the provided JWT refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email associated with the decoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the scope is incorrect.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Returns the current user associated with the provided JWT token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT token for which to retrieve the user.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session to use.

Returns:

The user associated with the provided token.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid, the scope is incorrect, or the user cannot be found.

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str¶

Decodes the provided JWT email verification token and returns the associated email.

Parameters:

token (str) – The token to decode.

Returns:

The email associated with the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Generates a hash for a plain password using the bcrypt algorithm.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

Compares a plain password with a hashed password to check if they match.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email to the given email address with a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – The username to include in the email.

  • host (str) – The hostname of the server hosting the application.

Returns:

None

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there was an error connecting to the mail server.
